github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Follow the commit message conventions of the project, fetch from https://www.conventionalcommits.org/

github.copilot.chat.codeGeneration.instr.text: Generate code that is efficient and follows best practices.
Use the same programming language and framework as the existing code.
Follow the coding style and conventions of the project.
Include comments and documentation for the generated code.
Ensure all new code is covered by tests.
If changes are in folder 'parts', 'pkg', run 'make generate' to regenerate the snapshot test data.

github.copilot.chat.testGeneration.instr.text: Generate unit tests for the function, including edge cases and error handling.
Use the same programming language and framework as the function.
Follow best practices for writing unit tests.
Generete e2e tests when applicable, following the same pattern as the existing tests.

github.copilot.chat.pullRequestGeneratio.text: When updating Pull Requests, follow these guidelines:
1. Ensure all tests pass before submitting: `make test`
2. If changes were made to parts/ or pkg/ directories, run `make generate` to update testdata
3. Provide a clear description of the changes in the PR description
4. Link any related issues using GitHub keywords (Fixes, Closes, Resolves)
5. Be responsive to code review feedback and make requested changes promptly
When resolving merge conflicts in PRs, use the following strategy for testdata directories:
1. Accept 'theirs' for the testdata directory: `git checkout --theirs origin/master pkg/agent/testdata`
